channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: TikTokのシュウ・ジー・チューCEOとのQ&A：アリゾナ州メサで開催される同社の音楽祭、彼の経歴、TikTokと音楽、音楽レーベル、米国の精査、モデレーションなどについて（Dexter Thomas/Wired）
item.description:
Dexter Thomas / Wired:
Q&A with TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew on the company's music festival in Mesa, AZ, his background, TikTok and music, music labels, US scrutiny, moderation, and more  —  A few weeks ago, Shou Zi Chew sat down with WIRED to tell us how he's trying to make TikTok better.

item.title: 情報源：一部の独立系レコード・レーベルは、アップルが空間オーディオ・トラックにより多く支払うという計画に反発している。
item.description:
Anna Nicolaou / Financial Times:
Sources: some independent record labels are pushing back on Apple's plans to pay more for spatial audio tracks, saying it benefits larger record companies  —  Groups behind Adele and Phoebe Bridgers among those against songs recorded in higher-quality audio receiving more money

item.title: 音楽業界の調査報道で知られ、ピューリッツァー賞を受賞したロサンゼルス・タイムズのジャーナリスト、チャック・フィリップスが1月に71歳で死去（Chris Willman/Variety）
item.description:
Chris Willman / Variety:
Chuck Philips, a Pulitzer Prize-winning Los Angeles Times journalist known for his investigative reporting on the music industry, died in January at age 71  —  Chuck Philips, a Pulitzer Prize-winning investigative journalist renowned for his reporting on dark corners of the music industry, died in January at age 71.

item.title: メッセンジャーの失敗は、ジミー・フィンケルスタインがトラフィックを追う戦略のような悪いアイデアを見抜けなかった結果であり、経済的な逆風のせいではない（Joshua Benton/Nieman Lab）
item.description:
Joshua Benton / Nieman Lab:
The Messenger's flop was the result of Jimmy Finkelstein's blindness to bad ideas, like its traffic-chasing strategy, not a consequence of economic headwinds  —  The flaws in the site's strategy were highly predictable (and repeatedly predicted).  But Jimmy Finkelstein's muddled nostalgia …

item.title: 株主や現・元従業員へのインタビューによると、SIの発行元であるアリーナ社がライセンス料の支払いを怠ったのは、資金不足のためではなく、自らの選択によるものであることが示唆されている（Kevin T. Dugan/New York Magazine）。
item.description:
Kevin T. Dugan / New York Magazine:
Interviews with shareholders and current and ex-employees suggest that SI's publisher Arena missed the licensing payment by choice, not because it lacked money  —  At about 4 p.m. on Thursday, January 25, the board of the media conglomerate the Arena Group met after the company had blown up its license to publish Sports Illustrated.

item.title: メタ、第4四半期の売上高は前年同期比25％増の401億ドル、広告収入は387億ドル、アプリ・ファミリー全体の広告インプレッション数は21％増、平均広告価格は2％増（Salvador Rodriguez/Wall Street Journal）
item.description:
Salvador Rodriguez / Wall Street Journal:
Meta reports Q4 revenue up 25% YoY to $40.1B, with ad revenue of $38.7B, ad impressions delivered across its Family of Apps up 21%, and average ad price up 2%  —  Company posts biggest quarterly revenue gains in two years  —  Facebook parent Meta Platforms posted its fourth consecutive quarter …

item.title: メッセンジャーの元従業員、解雇前に適切な通告を怠ったとして閉鎖された同店を集団提訴（The Daily Beast紙）
item.description:
The Daily Beast:
Ex-employees of The Messenger file a class-action lawsuit against the shuttered outlet, alleging that it failed to give them proper notice ahead of their firing  —  The class-action lawsuit comes just a day after The Messenger closed up shop for good, firing its hundreds of staff without offering them severance.

item.title: メモウォール・ストリート・ジャーナル紙のエマ・タッカーEICがDC支局をリストラ、DCを拠点とするビジネス・チームと米中チームを閉鎖し、「多数の」スタッフを解雇（Max Tani/@maxwelltani）
item.description:
Max Tani / @maxwelltani:
Memo: The Wall Street Journal EIC Emma Tucker restructures its DC bureau, shutters the DC-based Business and US-China teams, and lays off “a number” of staffers  —  Note from WSJ EIC Emma Tucker to Journal staff about today's layoffs changes to the paper's DC bureau. The business team and Washington-based China team are both shuttering. [image]

item.title: アップル第1四半期：Apple TV+とApple Musicを含むサービス部門の売上は前年同期比11％増の231億ドルと過去最高、インストールベースは22億台のアクティブデバイスを突破（Todd Spangler/Variety）
item.description:
Todd Spangler / Variety:
Apple Q1: revenue of Services, which includes Apple TV+ and Apple Music, rose 11% YoY to a record $23.1B, and installed base crossed 2.2B active devices  —  Apple turned in another record quarter in its services business, as strong iPhone 15 sales boosted total revenue in the last three months of 2023.

item.title: アマゾン第4四半期：広告収入は前年同期比27％増の147億ドル（予想142億ドル）、サブスクリプション収入は前年同期比14％増の105億ドル、北米セグメントの売上高は前年同期比13％増の1,055億ドル（Annie Palmer/CNBC
item.description:
Annie Palmer / CNBC:
Amazon Q4: ad revenue up 27% YoY to $14.7B, vs. $14.2B est., subscription revenue up 14% YoY to $10.5B, and North America segment sales up 13% YoY to $105.5B  —  - Amazon reported fourth-quarter earnings and revenue on Thursday that sailed past analysts' estimates.

item.title: グーグルは、サードパーティのクッキーに取って代わる「プライバシー・サンドボックス」の下で、ニュースパブリッシャーが自社の5つのウェブサイトでユーザーを追跡することを制限する計画だ（Jim Edwards/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Jim Edwards / Press Gazette:
Google plans to limit news publishers to tracking users across five of their own websites under its Privacy Sandbox, which is set to replace third-party cookies  —  Details have emerged of how Google's Privacy Sandbox could strengthen its online monopoly.  —  Google plans to limit the sharing …

item.title: Netflixのプレスイベントのハイライト：ライブ番組の推進、劇場公開の予定なし、他社からのコンテンツライセンスはオリジナル作品に影響しない、その他（Lesley Goldberg/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Lesley Goldberg / The Hollywood Reporter:
Highlights from Netflix's press event: a push for live programming, no planned theatrical releases, licensing content from others won't impact originals, more  —  A greater push for live programming, no theatrical releases and much more from content chief Bela Bajaria.

item.title: プライマリー・ウェーブ・ミュージックが、約40組のアーティストの音楽カタログを保有するブラジルのNas Nuvens社の株式50％を取得、Nas Nuvens社の価値は〜1億ドル（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
Primary Wave Music acquires a 50% stake in the Brazilian company Nas Nuvens, which holds music catalogs of about 40 artists, valuing Nas Nuvens at ~$100M  —  - Primary Wave invests in the Brazilian company Nas Nuvens  — Funding round values Nas Nuvens at around $100 million

item.title: 情報源：アリーナの幹部が、トランスジェンダーのボクシング記事を紙面から削除するようSIに命じた。
item.description:
Ben Strauss / Washington Post:
Sources: an Arena executive ordered SI to remove a transgender boxing story from a print issue; SI says the story was no longer newsy and will be posted online  —  The publisher of Sports Illustrated called for the removal of a story about transgender boxing from an upcoming issue of the print magazine …

item.title: 音楽、ポッドキャスト、映画の制作・配信・販売を手がけるGammaがAlpha Wave Global主導で1億ドル以上を調達、情報筋によると評価額は4億ドル（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
Gamma, which creates, distributes, and markets music, podcasts and films, raised $100M+ led by Alpha Wave Global, sources say at a $400M valuation  —  - Alpha Wave Global leads round valuing company at $400 million  — Former Apple executive Larry Jackson launched company in 2023
